data.title: UKL421 - Chair of Ukrainian Studies
data.text: compiled by Dominique Arel Chair of Ukrainian Studies, U of Ottawa www.ukrainianstudies.uottawa.ca Supported by the Dopomoha Ukraini Foundation #421 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 28 September 2007 1-Seminar on Canadian Technical Assistance in Ukraine, Chair of Ukrainian Studies/ Ukrainian Canadian Congress, U of Ottawa, 11 October 2007 2-exitpoll.org.ua: The National Exit Poll 2007: Who Conducts It and How? [UKL translation] 3-Kyiv International Institute of Sociology: Electoral Intentions of Ukrainian Voters—A Month Before Elections (14 September)[UKL translation and annotation] 4-CTV.ca: Gerard Kennedy Confronted by Police in Ukraine 5-UNIAN: Yanukovych Sacked His American Spin Doctor…Or Did He? 6-Financial Times: Ukraine’s Contenders Fight Over Jaded Populace 7-BusinessUkraine.com: Tammy Lynch, Election Observers Descend on Ukraine 8-Irish Times: Yushchenko Refuses Neutral Stance as Poll Looms 9-Wall Street Journal: Adrian Karatnycky, Splitting Image 10-Eurasia Daily Monitor: Akhmetov Expands Steel and Iron Holdings 11-Ukrains’ka pravda: The Party of Regions Candidate List—Who Are These People? (10 August 2007) [UKL translation and annotation] 12-Lyudmila Pavliuk and Adrian Erlinger: Framing Political Advertisements and Ideological Repertoires in the 2007 Ukrainian Parliamentary Campaign 13-OSCE Election Observation Mission Ukraine: Mid-September Report **Thanks to Jars Balan, Orest Deychakiwsky, Adrian Erlinger, Daniel Galadza, Katherine Huk, Adrian Karatnycky, Ilya Khineyko, Taras Kuzio, Tammy Lynch, Lyudmila Pavliuk, Blair Ruble (Kennan Institute), Ostap Skrypnyk, and Roman Zurba** #1 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Seminar on Canadian Technical Assistance in Ukraine Chair of Ukrainian Studies, University of Ottawa, Canada 11 October 2007 The Chair of Ukrainian Studies at the University of Ottawa, in partnership with the Ukrainian Canadian Congress, and with the financial assistance of the Canadian International Development Agency, is organizing the Seminar “Canadians in Ukraine: Fifteen Years of Canadian Technical Assistance Projects in Ukraine,” at the University of Ottawa on October 11, 2007. The Seminar Program appears below and is available in PDF at www.ukrainianstudies.uottawa.ca. Since Ukrainian independence, Canadian organizations have undertaken hundreds of
